trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when an error occurs during event tracing for Windows (ETW).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceException"></xref> class with a specified error message.
The message that describes the error.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceException"></xref> class with serialized data.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSourceException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or `null` if no inner exception is specified.
